active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of using default ports for convenience versus changing them for security: What are the risks of predictability (e.g., Nmap scans), and when might defaults be acceptable? Support with real-world examples like the Mirai botnet.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Use common misconceptions (e.g., confuse well-known with registered ports)
Include similar ports/services (e.g., 8080 as 'default HTTP' vs true 80)
Incorporate real errors (e.g., unsecured changes without firewall)
Avoid obvious wrongs; make plausible based on research (e.g., dynamic ports as 'well-known')

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education on 'Default Port Configuration' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 009_Security Misconfiguration > Server and Platform Configuration > Default Port Configuration). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4 scaffolding layers, and flashcard schema to create high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. Incorporate: - Security risks: Predictable ports enable Nmap scanning, automated attacks (e.g., Mirai on defaults like 23/Telnet). - Standards: IANA (RFC 6335, RFC 7605), NIST SP 800-44 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/Legacy/SP/nistspecialpublication800-44ver2.pdf), OWASP A06:2021. - Sources: IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry (https://www.iana.org/assignments/service-names-port-numbers/service-names-port-numbers.xhtml), RFC 6335 (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6335.html). Follow Bloom's Taxonomy progression. Output ONLY in JSON array of flashcards, each matching the schema: {'front': 'Question with A/B/C/D options', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['D1 reason', 'D2 reason', 'D3 reason'], 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'related_activity': '...'}}. Generate 25 flashcards spanning all objectives and layers, with distractors per protocol. Ensure active learning ties (e.g., 'Relates to problem-solving exercise').
